p: All data were analyzed using SPSS V20.0 (IBM, New York, NY, USA). In the fumigant and contact assays, LC 50 and LD 50 values were calculated with Probit analysis [ 50]; 95% CI (Confidence interval), related parameters and chi-square values were estimated. In the repellent assays, the percent repellency (PR) was determined by the following equation: PR (%) = [( Nc − Nt)/( Nc + Nt)] × 100 where Nc is the number of insects on the control half and Nt is the number of insects on the treated half. Percentage repellency values were transformed into arcsine and square root values for one-way ANOVA followed by Tukey’s test, respectively. Differences between means were considered significant when p < 0.05.
